name: HyLight
headline: Small unmanned hydrogen airships for long range monitoring
description:
HyLight builds and operates autonomous airships for long range monitoring. We focus on detecting methane leaks on pipelines and defects on power lines.

Our innovation, the HyLighter, is a crossover between drone and airship technology. Like a drone, it is easily controllable and transportable. And, like an airship, it is extremely energy-efficient, enabling it to fly for up to 10 hours at slow speed (22mph) for optimal data collection which represents a range of 220miles. 

Today, energy infrastructure operators struggle with conducting inspections that are simultaneously: massive and precise. HyLight offers a solution to precisely detect issues on the infrastructure at an industrial scale, and all of this without emitting GHGs.

We are 3 co-founders experienced in hardware and energy companies with Masters in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science and Business from the best Engineering and Business School in France.

We have developed 5 different flying aircrafts and signed 5 pilots programs with major energy infrastructure operators. We also have LOIs worth over $3.5M.

founders.name: Thomas Laporte, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder & CBO at HyLight | My goal is to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. At HyLight, I do that by helping our clients replace a bad solution with a high carbon footprint by our great solution with zero carbon footprint. I support utilities in taking care of critical energy infrastructure and help them in detecting defects before the outage.

founders.name: Martin Bocken, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder & CEO of @HyLight. I'm a doer at heart, my engineering background helped me to launch several entrepreneurial projects. I devote my energy to creating and designing the innovations that will enable us to live in a low-carbon world tomorrow.

founders.name: Josef Rokusek, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder & CTO of @HyLight. With a boundless passion for innovation and a commitment to sustainable solutions, I've dedicated my life to making a difference in the world. My journey began with a solid foundation in mechanical engineering and sustainable energy. This background provided me with the tools to turn my creative ideas into real-world innovations. My mission? Lead the change in reshaping society's approach to technology, making it environmentally friendly.

The HyLighter technology is made for **long range** and **precise** inspections for **safe** infrastructure management in **compliance** with your requirements.
[Inspecting![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/644903f0c2917bd99f4144ad/644903f0c2917ba5b841452f_Black%20Arrow.svg)](https://www.hylight.aero/<#Developers>)[Reporting![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/644903f0c2917bd99f4144ad/644903f0c2917ba5b841452f_Black%20Arrow.svg)](https://www.hylight.aero/<#Containers>)
Long range and precise inspections
HyLight deals with inspecting your infrastructure with our multi-sensor technology, ensuring that we collect all the information you need in 1 single flight. We handle all operations from flight planning, to logistics and data collection.
Actionable information
HyLight provides you with reports on the condition of your infrastructure with accurate location of detected defects.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/644903f0c2917bd99f4144ad/64a1a77f64a2d2510e568ad6_zeppelin2.png)

generated_description:
**Company Overview: HyLight**

**Founded:** 2022  
**Location:** Paris, France  
**Team Size:** 9 employees  
**Y Combinator Batch:** S23

**Mission:** HyLight is set on revolutionizing infrastructure monitoring with small, unmanned hydrogen airships. Their primary focus is on long-range monitoring, specifically detecting methane leaks in pipelines and identifying defects in power lines.

**The Product - HyLighter:**  
Imagine a hybrid between a drone and an airship. That’s the HyLighter. This ingenious piece of technology is not just easy to control and transport like a drone; it’s also exceptionally energy-efficient, allowing it to stay airborne for up to 10 hours at a cruising speed of 22 mph. In practical terms, that translates to a 220-mile range for comprehensive data collection without the carbon footprint—a big deal in today’s climate-conscious world.

**Addressing the Challenge:**  
Energy infrastructure operators face a dual challenge of inspecting vast networks while ensuring precision. Traditional methods often fall short, leaving critical issues undetected. HyLight steps in here, providing industrial-scale precision in monitoring, all without emitting greenhouse gases (GHGs).

**Founders:** The team consists of three co-founders who bring strong backgrounds in hardware and energy sectors, holding master's degrees in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, and Business from France's leading institutions.

**Achievements So Far:**  
- Development of five unique flying aircraft models.  
- Secured pilot programs with five major energy infrastructure operators.  
- Letters of Intent (LOIs) worth over $3.5 million.  

**Core Values and Tags:**  
HyLight is grouped under industry tags that highlight its commitment to hydrogen energy, business-to-business (B2B) solutions, climate initiatives, energy efficiency, and aerospace innovations.

**Online Presence:**  
You can learn more about their innovative solutions and vision by visiting their website at [HyLight](https://www.hylight.aero/).

In summary, HyLight isn’t just another tech startup; it’s a thoughtfully crafted solution to a pressing problem in the energy sector. Their unique approach, paired with a dedicated team, makes them a company worth watching as they stride into a more sustainable future.
